title: Photoelectric - work function vs lambda and max v

content.question: Ultraviolet light of wavelength <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math> is incident on a surface, causing electrons of mass <math alttext="m sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> to be emitted at various speeds between zero and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. What is the work function of the surface material?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction h c over lambda, end fraction, minus, one half m sub e, end sub, v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mi>λ</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="the fraction h c over lambda, end fraction, plus, one half m sub e, end sub, v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mi>λ</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="h lambda, minus, one half m sub e, end sub, v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>λ</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="h lambda, plus, one half m sub e, end sub, v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>λ</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction h c over lambda, end fraction, minus, one half m sub e, end sub, v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mi>λ</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
